conditions.name: Safety Review for Dose Titration
conditions.description: Safety Review Committee (SRC) must review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant before titration to 30 mg/day.
conditions.text: Before titration to 30 mg/day, the Safety Review Committee (SRC) will review available safety data through Day 23 for each participant.

conditions.name: ALT/AST Elevation (Moderate)
conditions.description: ALT or AST is greater than 3 times the upper limit of normal (ULN) and less than or equal to 5 times ULN.
conditions.text: ALT and/or AST > 3 × ULN and ≤ 5 × ULN

conditions.name: ALT/AST Elevation (Severe)
conditions.description: ALT or AST is greater than 5 times the upper limit of normal (ULN).

conditions.name: Severe Neutropenia
conditions.description: Neutrophil count is less than 1.0 x 10^9/L.

conditions.name: Significant Neutrophil Decrease
conditions.description: Neutrophil count decreases by more than 30% from baseline and is below the reference range.
conditions.text: > 30% ↓ from baseline Neutrophils below reference range

conditions.name: Potential Liver Injury (Hy's Law)
conditions.description: Bilirubin is greater than 2 times ULN accompanied by ALT greater than 3 times ULN.
conditions.text: Bilirubin > 2 × ULN Accompanied by ALT > 3 × ULN

conditions.name: Neurologic Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of neurologic worsening by Adverse Events or by neurologic physical exam assessment.
conditions.text: Evidence of neurologic worsening by AEs or by neurologic physical exam assessment

conditions.name: Psychiatric Worsening
conditions.description: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening which may include but not limited to suicidality, acute depression, or psychosis.
conditions.text: Evidence of clinically significant acute psychiatric worsening

conditions.name: Maximum Rechallenges
conditions.description: A maximum of 3 dose rechallenges are allowed after dose interruption.
conditions.text: A maximum of 3 rechallenges will be allowed.

transitionRules.name: Dose Titration to 30 mg/day
transitionRules.text: Following the Run-in Period, participants will be administered ALXN1840 at 15 mg/day for a treatment period of approximately 28 days followed by titration up to 30 mg/day on Day 29.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Moderate ALT/AST Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT/AST > 3x ULN and <= 5x ULN, reduce dose to previous dose level or to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD. No further dose increase until resolution.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Severe ALT/AST Elevation
transitionRules.text: If ALT/AST > 5x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing. Rechallenge at 15 mg QOD when ALT/AST is < 3x ULN.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Severe Neutropenia
transitionRules.text: If Neutrophils < 1.0 x 10^9/L, temporarily interrupt dosing. Rechallenge at 15 mg QOD when neutrophils are > 1.0 x 10^9/L.

transitionRules.name: Dose Reduction for Significant Neutrophil Decrease
transitionRules.text: If Neutrophils decrease > 30% from baseline and are below reference range, reduce dose to previous dose level or to 15 mg QOD if on 15 mg QD.

transitionRules.name: Dose Interruption for Potential Liver Injury
transitionRules.text: If Bilirubin > 2x ULN with ALT > 3x ULN, temporarily interrupt dosing. Rechallenge requires Medical Monitor approval.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Hypersensitivity
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention if a serious hypersensitivity reaction occurs.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Severe Infection
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for a severe uncontrolled infection.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Disallowed Medication
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for use of disallowed medication.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation for Pregnancy
transitionRules.text: Participants must be considered for discontinuation from study intervention for pregnancy or planned pregnancy.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Participant Withdrawal of Consent
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may withdraw from the study at any time at his/her own request.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Discretionary Withdrawal
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant may be withdrawn at any time at the discretion of the Investigator for safety, behavioral, compliance, or administrative reasons.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant will be considered lost to follow-up if he or she repeatedly fails to return for scheduled visits and is unable to be contacted by the study site.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A participant is considered to have completed the study if he/she has completed all phases of the study including the last scheduled procedure shown in the Schedule of Activities (SoA).

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Sponsor Termination of Study
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Alexion reserves the right to close the study site or terminate the study at any time for any reason at the sole discretion of Alexion.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Titration Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point on Day 29 to titrate dose from 15 mg/day to 30 mg/day, based on safety review of data through Day 23.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Dose Modification for Safety
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision to modify, interrupt, or discontinue dose based on predefined safety criteria related to liver function, hematology, or neurologic/psychiatric status.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Adaptive Outpatient Period Extension
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: At the discretion of the Investigator, the Outpatient Period may be extended up to an additional 14 days to support conduct of the study.
